info.title: Goal Targets
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: Use goals data to create reports for your sales or service team to analyze how your reps are performing.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Goals in HubSpot are user-specific quotas for their sales and services teams based on templates provided by HubSpot. The goals API allows you to retrieve goals data in your HubSpot account.

post.summary: Read a batch of goal targets by internal ID, or unique property values

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

get.description: Read an Object identified by `{goalTargetId}`. `{goalTargetId}` refers to the internal object ID by default, or optionally any unique property value as specified by the `idProperty` query param.  Control what is returned via the `properties` query param.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with their history of previous values. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

parameters.name: idProperty
parameters.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object

delete.description: Move an Object identified by `{goalTargetId}` to the recycling bin.

patch.description: Perform a partial update of an Object identified by `{goalTargetId}`. `{goalTargetId}` refers to the internal object ID by default, or optionally any unique property value as specified by the `idProperty` query param. Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will be ignored. Properties values can be cleared by passing an empty string.

parameters.name: idProperty
parameters.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object type

post.summary: Archive a batch of goal targets by ID
Create a batch of goal targets
Update a batch of goal targets

get.description: Read a page of goal targets. Control what is returned via the `properties` query param.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with their history of previous values. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored. Usage of this parameter will reduce the maximum number of objects that can be read by a single request.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

post.description: Create a goal target with the given properties and return a copy of the object, including the ID. Documentation and examples for creating standard goal targets is provided.

post.summary: Create or update a batch of goal targets by unique property values
